result.execSummary:
The defendant Baldemar Trejo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to Count 2 with credit for 0 days time served.

miscConds.notes: AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact, subject to any valid injunction.
No use of corporal punishment.

Anger Management, and continued programming.
Sucessfully complete a parenting class.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Baldemar Trejo in court with attorney Andres Velez.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Statements made by Beth T.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

As to Counts 1 and 2 as amended:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Beth T.

As to Count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction consecutive to Count 2 with credit for 0 days time served.  

As to Count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months in the House of Correction consecutive to Count 1 with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 40 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Sucessfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact, subject to any valid injunction.
-No use of corporal punishment.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Victim Impact Statement, Reoprt of Completion of Parant Education Requirement, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40. Court ordered jury trial date of 06/082015 vacated.

Defendant Baldamar Trejo in court with attorney Andres Velez.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to two counts of Misdemeanor Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 940.19(1), Class A Misdemeanors.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Baldamar Trejo in court with attorney Andres Velez.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Baldamar Trejo in court with attorney Andres Velez.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Baldamar Trejo in court with attorney Andres Velez.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for Indigency hearing. Defendant has retained counsel. Court examined the defendant as to his right to have a preliminary hearing within the time limits and found defendant freely, knowingly, intelligantly and voluntarily waived the time limits. Court vacates preliminary hearing on 3-12-2015.   Case is adjourned to Branch 40.   Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RT dob 1/28/08 or BT dob 2/23/06

Defendant Baldamar Trejo in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Baldamar Trejo in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Indigency hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
